Title: Tinubu, Obi, Fayemi meet at Pope Leo’s inauguration
Summary: President Bola Tinubu; former Ekiti State governor, Kayode Fayemiand his Anambracounterpart, who flew the Labour Party flag in the 2023 general election, Peter Obi, joined dignitaries and global leaders .

Title: Seplat’s performance surpasses board’s expectations, says chairman
Summary: The 2024 performance of Seplat Energy Plc met and exceeded the expectation of the board of directors, says the Chairman . Senator Udoma Udo UdomA said this on the sidelines of the company’s 12th yearly general meeting held virtually .

Title: Oniru hails Access Holdings on community development
Summary: The Oniru of Iru Kingdom, Oba Abdulwasiu Omogbolahan Lawal, Abisogun II, hails Access Holdings for its contribution to infrastructure, security, and socio-economic development in Iruland . Oba describes the institution as a “true partner in progress”

Title: SERAP tasks NNPCL on alleged missing N500b oil revenue
Summary: SERAP tasks NNPCL on alleged missing N500b oil revenue . Group Chief Executive Officer of the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited (NNPCL) Bayo Bashir Ojulari .

Title: ‘Harmony project will arrest governorship crisis in Imo State’
Summary: There are three zones in the state, namely, Orlu, Owerri and Okigwe . You know, since the transition to civil democracy happened in 1999, several people have governed Imo State .

Title: 2027: I won’t contest against Tinubu – Wike
Summary: The former Rivers State governor emphasised that there is currently no opposition candidate strong enough to challenge the president successfully . Wike said there is no candidate currently capable of challenging President Tinubu .

Title: Dangote Refinery gets 146,000 metric tonnes of oil from global market
Summary: Dangote Petroleum Refinery has taken delivery of 146,000 metric tonnes of crude oil from international market . Hercules, Hercules, is still discharging the cargo . Another vessel, Sienna, is scheduled to arrive with 125,000 tonnes of oil for refining .

Title: 75% of goods from Benin ports bound for Nigeria—Reps Speaker
Summary: More than 75 percent of goods offloaded in Benin Republic ports are bound for Nigeria . Tajudeen Abbas blames inefficiencies and high costs at Nigerian ports . Abbas stated this when he received a delegation from the Presidential .

Title: Recovery begins in manufacturing sector as revenue, profits soar
Summary: Major companies record 51.9% rise in revenue to N1.6trn . Profit rises 180% to N218.35bn . Backward integration a factor – NACCIMA, •Nigerian Breweries attributes it to financial restructuring .

Title: N50bn Earned Allowances: Crisis brews in varsities as SSANU, NASU reject sharing formula
Summary: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities, SSANU and the Non-Academic Staff Union of Educational and Associated Institutions, NASU reject the sharing formula of the N50 billion Earned Allowances .

Title: One dead, three rescued in Lagos building collapse
Summary: One of the construction workers trapped under the rubble of the collapsed building at Idi Araba in the Mushin area of Lagos State has been recovered dead . Title: NNPCL refineries not producing enough petrol – DAPPMAN
Summary: Depot and Petroleum Products Marketers Association of Nigeria has said that its members can only buy Premium Motor Spirit (petrol) from the Dangote Petroleum Refinery . Title: FG grants China approval to establish electric vehicle factories
Summary: The Chinese Ambassador to Nigeria, Yu Dunhai, has harped on the imperative of enhanced collaboration between China and Nigeria in unlocking the potential of Nigeria’s Solid Minerals sector . Dunhai said Nigeria is a great country blessed with tremendous natural resources . He said China has always placed Nigeria in a very pivotal position in its foreign policy

Title: Suspected Lagos cultists kill shawarma vendor
Summary: Some yet-to-be-identified gunmen suspected to be cultists have killed a popular shawarma vendor . The victim, also known as Benji, was the owner of the popular Chibest Shawarma in the Ikorodu area of Lagos State . The attack occurred on Tuesday, around 8:30 p.

Title: Patients left to die: Inside Abuja’s horror public healthcare system
Summary: In the last five years, Nigeria has lost about 16,000 doctors to other countries, according to the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare . Over 75% of Nigerian-trained doctors have left, seeking better working conditions, modern equipment, and a healthcare system that supports them, things they can’t find at home . Public hospitals
